intro: Arrabidaea candicans, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Arrabidaea candicans is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
